entries.title: US Senator calls for probe into law enforcement mass surveillance
entries.description: Ron Wyden has said that state and local authorities have accessed data collections without court oversight.

entries.title: Janet Yellen, Chinese Vice Premier Liu have ‘candid’ talks
entries.description: The US Treasury said both sides agreed to enhance cooperation on climate change and the economy.

entries.title: UN chief blasts Big Oil for ‘peddling the big lie’ on climate
entries.description: Failure to act on the climate crisis means 'parts of our planet will be uninhabitable' and 'a death sentence' for many.

entries.title: Mother and one-year-old son killed in rare polar bear attack
entries.description: The 'traumatic' attack occurred on Tuesday near a school in an isolated Alaska Native village in the northwest US.

entries.title: US Fed chief Powell tests positive for COVID
entries.description: Jerome Powell has mild symptoms and is working remotely while isolating at home.

entries.title: Brazil moves forward with riot investigation after capital attack
entries.description: Brazilian authorities have launched a probe to discover who financed the far-right effort to overturn the 2022 election.

entries.title: What’s fuelling public anger in Peru?
entries.description: Protests calling for change have taken place since the former president was impeached and arrested.

entries.title: US arrests Russian crypto boss who ‘catered to known crooks’
entries.description: Justice dept says Anatoly Legkodymov operated the Hong Kong-registered Bitzlato exchange as a money laundering haven.

entries.title: Dozens of people killed as cold wave sweeps Afghanistan
entries.description: About 70,000 cattle have perished in a week as many provinces witness deep freeze amid a humanitarian crisis.

entries.title: Saudi foreign minister sees progress towards ending Yemen war
entries.description: Speaking in Davos, Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud said a political settlement was needed to end the 8-year conflict.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy invites China’s President Xi for ‘dialogue’
entries.description: Zelenskyy's wife Olena says a letter of invitation was handed to the Chinese delegation in Davos.

entries.title: Greenland temperatures hottest in 1,000 years: Study
entries.description: A new study of Greenland's ice cores indicates that rising temperatures bear the 'clear signature of global warming'.

entries.title: Abducted Burkina Faso women flee gunmen as attacks spike
entries.description: Military leader Captain Ibrahim Traore said armed men are switching tactics to target more civilians.

entries.title: US retail sales fall more than expected in December
entries.description: The broad drop in sales together with subsiding inflation should lead to a slowdown in the pace of interest rate hikes.

entries.title: F-16 sale, Syria, NATO on agenda as top US, Turkey diplomats meet
entries.description: The meeting is the first official US visit by Turkish Foreign Minister Cavusoglu since Biden administration took office.

entries.title: Ukraine mourns latest tragedy as Putin promises Russian victory
entries.description: Russian leader's remarks come as Kyiv grapples with the loss of its interior minister in a deadly helicopter crash.

entries.title: Dnipro attack to helicopter crash: Ukraine suffers a tough week
entries.description: A retreat, a missile blitz and a helicopter crash were the low points of a horrible 47th week of the war for Ukraine.

entries.title: Deportation punishment for activism against Israel, Hammouri says
entries.description: Palestinian Salah Hammouri, whom Israel deported to France, plans to make his return to Jerusalem his life's work.

entries.title: US professor sues university over Prophet Muhammad image row
entries.description: University says it is reviewing actions after art professor's contract not renewed amid student objection.

entries.title: Microsoft to layoff 10,000 people, increasing job cuts in tech
entries.description: The layoffs, far larger than cuts by Microsoft last year, pile on to tens of thousands of tech-sector job cuts.

entries.title: Will Ukraine interior minister’s death cut reforms short?
entries.description: Denys Monastyrskyy was intent on shaking up policing system after years of scandals.

entries.title: Senior UN officials in Afghanistan to press for women’s rights
entries.description: The delegation includes Deputy Secretary-General Amina Mohammed and Sima Bahous, executive secretary of UN Women.

entries.title: DRC police disperse protest against slow M23 rebel pullback
entries.description: The rebels have been accused of flouting a ceasefire and making withdrawals critics consider to be mainly ceremonial.

entries.title: Ten Chinese snooker players hit with match-fixing charges
entries.description: Governing body suspends some of sport's biggest names ahead of formal hearing.

entries.title: The World Cup, in Guantanamo
entries.description: As a former Guantanamo detainee, it was difficult for me to enjoy Qatar 2022.

entries.title: Who was Denys Monastyrskyy, Ukraine’s interior minister?
entries.description: Monastyrskyy, 42, was killed in a helicopter crash on the outskirts of Kyiv while en route to the front lines.

entries.title: Lavrov hails Moscow-Beijing ties, accuses US of provocations
entries.description: Russia's top diplomat says the West is searching for ways to anger China on a host of issues including Taiwan and Tibet.

entries.title: Don’t believe the hype; tanks are still vital for Ukraine
entries.description: Some say the time of the tank is over, but Ukraine needs the weapons to push Russia out of its territory.

entries.title: Gambian vice president dies after ‘short illness’ in India
entries.description: Joof was the fourth deputy to serve under President Barrow since his 2016 win against former strongman Yahya Jammeh.

entries.title: Ukraine helicopter crash: What we know so far
entries.description: Ukraine's Interior Minister Denys Monastyrskyy among 15 killed when helicopter came down on the outskirts of Kyiv, offic

entries.title: There should be no more Middle East exception in US policy
entries.description: Arab public opinion of the US is low because of its hypocrisy over the issue of democracy. It is time to change that.

entries.title: Attacks on electoral commission sparks concerns for Nigeria polls
entries.description: Experts say the new wave of attacks takes insecurity in Nigeria into uncharted territory ahead of the elections.

entries.title: S Korean spy agency raids unions over suspected North Korea link
entries.description: The National Intelligence Service and police raided the Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and an affiliate in Seoul.

entries.title: Helicopter crash kills 15, including Ukraine interior minister
entries.description: Crash near nursery in the town of Brovary kills at least 15 people, including Denys Monastyrskyy and three children.

entries.title: Riyadh All-Star XI vs PSG: What to know about the game
entries.description: As Ronaldo and Messi face off in Saudi Arabia, we take a look at when, where and how to watch the match.

entries.title: ‘Zero money equals zero safety’: A Ukrainian couple’s finances
entries.description: With so much uncertainty caused by the war, Iryna and Oleksandr are working to save as much cash as they can.

entries.title: Aid groups urge debt cancellation to ease Ghana’s economic woes
entries.description: In December, Ghana's finance ministry said interest payments have risen to 70 to 100 percent of government revenue.

entries.title: Another Khan party-led provincial assembly dissolved in Pakistan
entries.description: After Punjab, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa legislature dissolved as part of ex-PM Imran Khan's bid to force early national polls.

entries.title: Ukraine interior minister, several others die in helicopter crash
entries.description: Top Ukrainian officials and others, including children, killed as chopper crashes near nursery in Brovary, outside Kyiv.

entries.title: Australia to spend $2bn on fleet of US Black Hawk helicopters
entries.description: The Black Hawks replace Australia's fleet of European-designed Taipan helicopters which are being retired early.

entries.title: Police offer reward after murder of six people at California home
entries.description: Teenage mother and baby shot dead 'assassination style' in attack likely linked to a gang or drug cartel, sheriff says.

entries.title: Pakistan urged to act against forced child marriages, conversions
entries.description: UN rights experts deplore abductions, forced marriages and conversions of girls from Pakistan's religious minorities.

entries.title: The scramble to help Ukraine shows the need for more, better aid
entries.description: There is no shortage of money, only a shortage of political will to create a fairer world.

entries.title: Defending champion Rafael Nadal crashes out of Australian Open
entries.description: The Spanish star, suffering from an injury, was beaten in the second round by American Mackenzie McDonald.

entries.title: Infographic: Who are the oldest people in the world?
entries.description: The world's oldest known person, French nun Lucile Randon, has died at the age of 118.

entries.title: DRC president says M23 rebels yet to withdraw as agreed
entries.description: According to a November 2022 agreement, the rebel group was to withdraw from certain recently seized positions.

entries.title: Police carry Greta Thunberg away from German coal mine protest
entries.description: Thunberg was among hundreds who resumed protests at multiple locations in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia.

entries.title: Saudi businessman pays $2.6m for Ronaldo-Messi match ticket
entries.description: Proceeds of auctioned ticket for friendly between PSG and an all-star Saudi XI featuring Ronaldo will go to charity.

entries.title: As economic crisis deepens, will Egypt slow megaprojects down?
entries.description: The IMF announced an ambitious reform programme for Egypt’s economy, but analysts cast doubt on its effectiveness.

entries.title: Brazil charges 39 people over pro-Bolsonaro riots
entries.description: Prosecutors call for the 39 defendants to be imprisoned and that $7.7m of their assets be frozen to help cover damages.

entries.title: Tokyo court upholds acquittal of Fukushima disaster executives
entries.description: Prosecutors have argued that the executives were aware of the dangers of a nuclear plant located on Japan's coast.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 329
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 329th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Rights groups ask Sri Lanka to free student arrested for protests
entries.description: Wasantha Mudalige, arrested five months ago, is being held without charges under a harsh anti-terrorism law.

entries.title: Long wait for family of Indian whose Nepal crash video went viral
entries.description: Sonu Jaiswal’s 90-second smartphone video showing the aircraft approaching the runway at Pokhara had gone viral.

entries.title: Macau jails gambling ‘junket king’ Alvin Chau for 18 years
entries.description: Chau was charged with 289 counts of fraud, money laundering and illegal gambling over his casino 'junket' operation.

entries.title: Pacific Islands urge Japan to delay release of Fukushima waste
entries.description: Planned release of wastewater raises concerns among nations that are still grappling with legacy of nuclear testing.

entries.title: Philippines’s Maria Ressa acquitted of tax evasion
entries.description: Appellate tax court clears Philippine Nobel laureate Maria Ressa of all four charges of tax evasion filed against her.

entries.title: Lucile Randon, the oldest person in the world, dies at 118
entries.description: Randon, who became a nun in 1944, said work and caring for others were the main reasons for her longevity.

entries.title: Why are women still poorly represented in news media?
entries.description: In the news, women are far less likely to be seen as experts.

entries.title: California residents struggle to recover after weeks of storms
entries.description: Residents grapple with the effects of three straight weeks of severe weather as mudslides and rescue efforts continue.
